Title: regionToName
Description: Accepts a region ID and geobase and returns a string of the name of the region in the corresponding language. If the region with the specified ID does not exist, an empty string is returned.
id — Region ID from the geobase. UInt32.geobase — Dictionary key. See Multiple Geobases. String. Optional.
Name of the region in the corresponding language specified by geobase. String.Otherwise, an empty string.

Title: regionToCity
Description: Accepts a region ID from the geobase. If this region is a city or part of a city, it returns the region ID for the appropriate city. Otherwise, returns 0.
id — Region ID from the geobase. UInt32.geobase — Dictionary key. See Multiple Geobases. String. Optional.
Region ID for the appropriate city, if it exists. UInt32.0, if there is none.
Examples: SELECT regionToName(number::UInt32, 'en'), regionToCity(number::UInt32) AS id, regionToName(id, 'en') FROM numbers(13);

Title: regionToArea
Description: Converts a region to an area (type 5 in the geobase). In every other way, this function is the same as ‘regionToCity’.
id — Region ID from the geobase. UInt32.geobase — Dictionary key. See Multiple Geobases. String. Optional.
Region ID for the appropriate area, if it exists. UInt32.0, if there is none.

Title: regionToDistrict
Description: Converts a region to a federal district (type 4 in the geobase). In every other way, this function is the same as ‘regionToCity’.
id — Region ID from the geobase. UInt32.geobase — Dictionary key. See Multiple Geobases. String. Optional.
Region ID for the appropriate city, if it exists. UInt32.0, if there is none.

Title: regionToCountry
Description: Converts a region to a country (type 3 in the geobase). In every other way, this function is the same as ‘regionToCity’.
id — Region ID from the geobase. UInt32.geobase — Dictionary key. See Multiple Geobases. String. Optional.
Region ID for the appropriate country, if it exists. UInt32.0, if there is none.
Examples: SELECT regionToName(number::UInt32, 'en'), regionToCountry(number::UInt32) AS id, regionToName(id, 'en') FROM numbers(13);

Title: regionToContinent
Description: Converts a region to a continent (type 1 in the geobase). In every other way, this function is the same as ‘regionToCity’.
id — Region ID from the geobase. UInt32.geobase — Dictionary key. See Multiple Geobases. String. Optional.
Region ID for the appropriate continent, if it exists. UInt32.0, if there is none.
Examples: SELECT regionToName(number::UInt32, 'en'), regionToContinent(number::UInt32) AS id, regionToName(id, 'en') FROM numbers(13);

Title: regionToTopContinent
Description: Finds the highest continent in the hierarchy for the region.
id — Region ID from the geobase. UInt32.geobase — Dictionary key. See Multiple Geobases. String. Optional.
Identifier of the top level continent (the latter when you climb the hierarchy of regions).UInt32.0, if there is none.
Examples: SELECT regionToName(number::UInt32, 'en'), regionToTopContinent(number::UInt32) AS id, regionToName(id, 'en') FROM numbers(13);

Title: regionToPopulation
Description: Gets the population for a region. The population can be recorded in files with the geobase. See the section “Dictionaries”. If the population is not recorded for the region, it returns 0. In the geobase, the population might be recorded for child regions, but not for parent regions.
id — Region ID from the geobase. UInt32.geobase — Dictionary key. See Multiple Geobases. String. Optional.
Population for the region. UInt32.0, if there is none.
Examples: SELECT regionToName(number::UInt32, 'en'), regionToPopulation(number::UInt32) AS id, regionToName(id, 'en') FROM numbers(13);

Title: regionIn
Description: Checks whether a lhs region belongs to a rhs region. Returns a UInt8 number equal to 1 if it belongs, or 0 if it does not belong.
lhs — Lhs region ID from the geobase. UInt32.rhs — Rhs region ID from the geobase. UInt32.geobase — Dictionary key. See Multiple Geobases. String. Optional.
1, if it belongs. UInt8.0, if it doesn't belong.
The relationship is reflexive – any region also belongs to itself.
Examples: SELECT regionToName(n1.number::UInt32, 'en') || (regionIn(n1.number::UInt32, n2.number::UInt32) ? ' is in ' : ' is not in ') || regionToName(n2.number::UInt32, 'en') FROM numbers(1,2) AS n1 CROSS JOIN numbers(1,5) AS n2;

Title: regionHierarchy
Description: Accepts a UInt32 number – the region ID from the geobase. Returns an array of region IDs consisting of the passed region and all parents along the chain.
id — Region ID from the geobase. UInt32.geobase — Dictionary key. See Multiple Geobases. String. Optional.
Array of region IDs consisting of the passed region and all parents along the chain. Array(UInt32).
Examples: SELECT regionHierarchy(number::UInt32) AS arr, arrayMap(id -> regionToName(id, 'en'), arr) FROM numbers(5);
